meanings.definition: In a proud or arrogant manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked haughtily past the other students, with her nose in the air.
meanings.sent2: The queen looked haughtily at the commoners gathered in the square.
meanings.sent3: The cat sauntered haughtily across the room, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The eagle soared haughtily above the mountains, surveying its domain.
meanings.sent5: The actor delivered his lines haughtily, believing himself superior to the rest of the cast.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive pride or disdain towards others.
meanings.sent1: Her haughtily expression made it clear she thought she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The haughtily aristocrat refused to speak to anyone beneath her social status.
meanings.sent3: The peacock strutted haughtily around the farm, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered haughtily in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The bully's haughtily attitude made him unpopular among his classmates.
